item.description:
NameQuick v2.0.15

This release makes Templates rock‑solid with Claude, fixes an OpenAI schema edge case, and keeps spreadsheets fast and stable.

Highlights

  • Templates (Claude): Reliable structured output with consistent results.
  • OpenAI schema: Fixes rare “type: None” error in structured output.
  • Spreadsheets: Stable memory + faster previews for large XLSX files.
  • Error messages: Clearer, provider‑specific guidance.

Improvements

  • Templates (Claude)
    • Uses Claude Tools with an input schema to return clean JSON (no chatty responses).
    • Normalizes template field keys under the hood for tool compatibility; your template labels are unchanged.
  • Spreadsheet handling
    • Size‑aware parsing and smarter sampling keep memory bounded on large workbooks.
    • Faster, steadier previews for DOCX/PPTX/XLSX.
  • Error messages
    • Clearer document guidance and provider‑specific mapping (no generic attributions).
    • Unified wording for unsupported actions; suggests the next best path.

Fixes

  • Templates (Claude): Resolves “response_format: Extra inputs are not permitted” by switching to Tools.
  • OpenAI: Fixes rare structured‑output error (“schema must be type: object, got None”).
  • Office previews: Prevents spikes from embedded thumbnails; steadier memory.
  • Spreadsheet parsing: Resolves a leak in XLSX handling and aborts cleanly on extraction failures with clear guidance.

Thanks for using NameQuick and for all the feedback — it helps a ton.

— Josef

NameQuick v2.0.14

Release notes

NameQuick v2.0.14

This one focuses on smooth, reliable background processing and better document support — plus a new option for BYOK folks: Claude (Anthropic).

Highlights

  • New: You can now rename Word, PowerPoint, and Excel files (DOCX, PPTX, XLSX).
  • BYOK: Claude (Anthropic) joins the lineup with native PDF + image analysis and explicit model selection.

New

  • Word (.docx): Smart, clean names for your documents — fast previews included.
  • PowerPoint (.pptx): Uses slide text to suggest clear context-aware names.
  • Excel (.xlsx, .xlsm): Concise, informative names for your spreadsheets.
  • Quiet background mode: Keep NameQuick tucked away — it keeps watching your folders and renaming files.
  • BYOK: Added Claude (Anthropic) as a provider — native PDF support via Messages API, image analysis, explicit model selection, key validation, and per‑item cost shown in recent history.

Improvements

  • Folder recovery: If your Mac sleeps or a drive disconnects, NameQuick resumes and catches up automatically.
  • Startup experience: Files already in your watch folders appear instantly. Only new or changed files auto‑process (based on your settings).
  • UI: Cleaner, calmer loading indicator in the grid.

Fixes

  • Automatic processing could pause for some folders.
  • Files added later to a watched folder now process as expected.
  • PPTX files were sometimes flagged as unsupported — they now work consistently.

Thanks for using NameQuick and for all the feedback — it helps a ton.

— Josef
